page.title: 01THE SURVEY AREA
page.content: Our area includes the villages of { {Wotton}and{Westcott}and the western outskirts of{Dorking.}It is an area of outstanding beauty bordered by the chalk hills of{Ranmore}in the north. The{Tillingbourne river,}a tributary of the river{Mole,}flows through the area, other water features include{Bury Hill Lake,}situated on the southern border, and the{Rookery in Wotton. The land is used primarily for agriculture and housing but contains some light industry in the vicinity of Dorking Town railway station. The character of Westcott and Wotton can be explained, in part, by their position on the busy{A25 -an important {east-west routeway.}Their location in relation to{London}and the mainline station in Dorking makes them ideal homes for London{commuters.
